name: "Rent" Mania! - Act I Quiz | Musicals | 25 Questions

questions.text: When does the play start?
questions.explanation:
December 24, 9pm EST.

	The show starts on December 24, at 9pm EST. It's the first line of the first song. The line is song by Mark Cohen. In the original cast, Mark was played by Anthony Rapp.

questions.text: Whose mother calls first?
questions.explanation:
Mark's.

	Jonathon Larson wrote the book, music and lyrics.

questions.text: What happens to Collins in "Tune Up #2?
options: He gets a new pair of shoes
questions.explanation:
He's mugged.

	Jonathon Larson was born on February 4, 1960. He died on January 25, 1996.

questions.text: What two things do Mark and Roger set on fire to keep warm?
questions.explanation:
posters and screenplays.

	Benny was played by Taye Diggs.

questions.text: Who does Angel say is cute when he blushes?
questions.explanation:
Collins.

	Costume design was done by Angela Wendt.

questions.text: True or False:  Roger's girlfriend who killed herself was named June.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Her name was April. She left a note for Roger saying "we've got AIDS."

questions.text: What does Roger want to do before he dies?
questions.explanation:
Write one last song.

	"One Song Glory" -- Roger is played by Adam Pascal.

questions.text: Where does Mimi work?
questions.explanation:
Cat Scratch Club.

	Mimi also has AIDS as a result of being a drug addict.

questions.text: What does Joanne's mother want her to wear at the hearing?
questions.explanation:
a bra.

	Joanne's mother was played by Gwen Stewart.  Her father was played by Byron Utley.

questions.text: Why does Collins say he was expelled?
questions.explanation:
His theory of actual reality.

	This is the first song in which Angel is dressed in drag. And to quote Mimi in Act II, "She looked good."

questions.text: What does Roger say Benny can't watch after "wiping out an entire tent city"?
questions.explanation:
It's a Wonderful Life.

	Benny used to room with Collins, Roger, Mark, and Maureen.

questions.text: True or False:  The "Tango Maureen" is done by Mark and Joanne.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Maureen dumped Mark for Joanne.

questions.text: Answer this question with the next line from the song. "Why chose fear?"
questions.correct: I'm a New Yorker!  Fear's my life!
options: I'm dying! Wouldn't you be scared?
Hey man! Get off my back!
questions.explanation:
I'm a New Yorker!  Fear's my life!.

	Gordon, who said this line, was played by Timothy Britten Parker.

questions.text: Who does Mimi want to take her out?
questions.explanation:
Roger.

	The choreography for this song was awesome. In the original cast Mimi was played by Daphne Rubin-Vega. Choreography was done by Marlies Yearby.

questions.text: Complete the lyric. "No day but, _______"
questions.explanation:
today.

	"No other road. No other way. No day but today." This is the main theme in the musical. With Angel, Roger, Mimi and Collins having AIDS they have to live life now because tomorrow may never come. Isn't this true for everyone though, even if we don't have AIDS? We should all live life to the fullest, because tomorrow may never come.

questions.text: The last line in "Will I" ask "Will I lose my ______?"
questions.explanation:
Dignity.

	Steve was played by Gilles Chiasson.  He also played the man with a squeegie, a waiter, and other small parts.

questions.text: Who does the Blanket Person say is "trying to kill his guilt"?
questions.explanation:
Mark.

	He refers to the camera man, which is Mark. If you're wondering why I put Ted Koppel in as a choice, in one of the lines in this song, Mark says, "Smile for Ted Koppel, Officer Martin!"

questions.text: What does Collins want to do in Santa Fe?
questions.explanation:
Open up a restaurant.

	It seems like everyone but Angel and Joanne wants to escape. Collins wants to go to Santa Fe, Mark hides behind a camera, Roger won't let anyone in (that is into his heart) for fear of losing them as he lost April, Mimi does drugs still, perhaps she's also hiding and the drugs help with that. Maureen cheats on her lovers, perhaps she has a fear of commitment, so she hurts them before she can be hurt.

questions.text: What is the love song Angel and Collins sing together?
questions.explanation:
I'll Cover You.

	This is such a romantic and wonderful song. Angel was played by Wilson Jermaine Heredia.  Collins was played by Jesse L. Martin.

questions.text: What is the name of the counselor (lawyer) Joanne talks to in "We're Okay"?
questions.explanation:
Steve.

	Joanne was played by Fredi Walker.

questions.text: What does Angel buy for Collins?
questions.explanation:
coat.

	There is a mistake in the booklet that comes with the cast recording for this show.  In the synopsis of the show it says "She also informs everyone that a riot has broken on Avenue A." The riot broke out on Avenue B. Avenue A is where Angel made the 1000 dollars for killing Evita (the Akita).

questions.text: What is the name of the desert in "Over the Moon"?
questions.explanation:
Cyberland.

	Maureen is played by Idina Menzel.

questions.text: What is Mimi's last name?
questions.explanation:
Marquez.

	The full names of the characters are: Mimi Marquez, Mark Cohen, Angel Dumott Schunard, Maureen Johnson, Joanne Jefferson, Tom Collins, Benjamin Coffin III, and Roger Davis.

questions.text: Fill in the blank of this lyric: "Walking through fire without a ______."
questions.explanation:
burn.

	Right before this song, Mimi takes her AZT break and Roger learns like him she has AIDS. Likewise she learns he has AIDS.

questions.text: Okay, last question, from the last song. What is the opposite of war?
questions.explanation:
creation.

	"Rent" was based on an opera called "La Boheme."
